          Note:<b>Note:</b>
          Clock icons indicate that users may not be available.
          Tooltips show the reason.
          <div id="message"><!---->
          <b>Note:</b>
          Clock icons indicate that users may not be available.
          Tooltips show the reason.
          <!----></div>

        These are the steps I did to reproduce this bug:<span class="line"><!---->These are the steps I did to reproduce this bug:<!----></span><br><br>1. Enable the #tab-groups-save feature<span class="line"><!---->1. Enable the #tab-groups-save feature<!----></span><br>2. Create 2 tab groups (Does not matter how many tabs are in them)<span class="line"><!---->2. Create 2 tab groups (Does not matter how many tabs are in them)<!----></span><br>3. Save both tab groups <span class="line"><!---->3. Save both tab groups <!----></span><br>    > You should see 2 new buttons appear in the bookmarks bar with the names of the saved tab groups.<span class="line"><!---->    &gt; You should see 2 new buttons appear in the bookmarks bar with the names of the saved tab groups.<!----></span><br>4. Click on the first tab group that was saved<span class="line"><!---->4. Click on the first tab group that was saved<!----></span><br>    > Will be the leftmost tab group button if the default Left to right mode is enabled.<span class="line"><!---->    &gt; Will be the leftmost tab group button if the default Left to right mode is enabled.<!----></span><br>    > Will be the right most tab group button if Right to left mode enabled.<span class="line"><!---->    &gt; Will be the right most tab group button if Right to left mode enabled.<!----></span><br><br>Please let me know if there are any differences between these steps and the ones described above!<span class="line"><!---->Please let me know if there are any differences between these steps and the ones described above!<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1305706#c17">Comment 17<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Wed, Mar 16, 2022, 12:22 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>

      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1305706#c17">Comment 17<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Wed, Mar 16, 2022, 12:22 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        we should probably go back to design and ask what we should do when there isnt any tabs in the tab group (i.e. the last tab is removed from the group, which closes the group)? there might be other issues here but we should either remove the saved tab group when there are no tabs (an invalid state for a group) or keep the last tab and just consider it a "group close" instead of removing the tab.<span class="line"><!---->we should probably go back to design and ask what we should do when there isnt any tabs in the tab group (i.e. the last tab is removed from the group, which closes the group)? there might be other issues here but we should either remove the saved tab group when there are no tabs (an invalid state for a group) or keep the last tab and just consider it a "group close" instead of removing the tab.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

        Setting Pri-1 to match security severity Medium. If this is incorrect, please reset the priority. Sheriffbot won't make this change again.<span class="line"><!---->Setting Pri-1 to match security severity Medium. If this is incorrect, please reset the priority. Sheriffbot won't make this change again.<!----></span><br><br>For more details visit <span class="line"><!---->For more details visit <!----></span>https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage"><!---->https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage<!----></a> - Your friendly Sheriffbot<span class="line"><!----> - Your friendly Sheriffbot<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">

        The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/f2d3c078ac66e0c535c357d8eeccc0d0fb795c4b<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/f2d3c078ac66e0c535c357d8eeccc0d0fb795c4b"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/f2d3c078ac66e0c535c357d8eeccc0d0fb795c4b<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>f2d3c078ac66e0c535c357d8eeccc0d0fb795c4b<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/f2d3c078ac66e0c535c357d8eeccc0d0fb795c4b"><!---->f2d3c078ac66e0c535c357d8eeccc0d0fb795c4b<!----></a><br>Author: dljames <<span class="line"><!---->Author: dljames &lt;<!----></span>dljames@google.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/dljames@google.com"><!---->dljames@google.com<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Fri Mar 18 17:27:41 2022<span class="line"><!---->Date: Fri Mar 18 17:27:41 2022<!----></span><br><br>Fixes the use after free bug when creating multiple saved tab group buttons.<span class="line"><!---->Fixes the use after free bug when creating multiple saved tab group buttons.<!----></span><br><br>In short, we change OnTabGroupButtonPressed to take a const TabGroupID& so that when we use base::BindRepeating in CreateTabGroupButton the value is automagically copied in the call back. This prevents us from losing our saved tab group data and accessing garbage values.<span class="line"><!---->In short, we change OnTabGroupButtonPressed to take a const TabGroupID&amp; so that when we use base::BindRepeating in CreateTabGroupButton the value is automagically copied in the call back. This prevents us from losing our saved tab group data and accessing garbage values.<!----></span><br><br>More information for using const& can be found here: <span class="line"><!---->More information for using const&amp; can be found here: <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/HEAD/docs/callback.md#binding-const-reference-parameters<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/HEAD/docs/callback.md#binding-const-reference-parameters"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/HEAD/docs/callback.md#binding-const-reference-parameters<!----></a><br><br><br>Bug: I62a9ba403416f964dc48013ea129c44084865ded<span class="line"><!---->Change-Id: I62a9ba403416f964dc48013ea129c44084865ded<!----></span><br>Reviewed-on: <span class="line"><!---->Reviewed-on: <!----></span>https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3533522<a class="undefined" target="_blank"         Merge review required: M100 is already shipping to beta.<span class="line"><!---->Merge review required: M100 is already shipping to beta.<!----></span><br><br>Please answer the following questions so that we can safely process your merge request:<span class="line"><!---->Please answer the following questions so that we can safely process your merge request:<!----></span><br>1. Why does your merge fit within the merge criteria for these milestones?<!----></span><br>- Chrome Browser: <span class="line"><!---->- Chrome Browser: <!----></span>https://chromiumdash.appspot.com/branches<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromiumdash.appspot.com/branches"><!---->https://chromiumdash.appspot.com/branches<!----></a><br>- Chrome OS: <span class="line"><!---->- Chrome OS: <!----></span>https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines"><!---->https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines<!----></a><br>2. If yes, is it behind a Finch flag and are experiments active in any release channels?<!----></span><br>5. [Chrome OS only]: Was the change reviewed and approved by the Eng Prod Representative? <span class="line"><!---->5. [Chrome OS only]: Was the change reviewed and approved by the Eng Prod Representative? <!----></span>https://goto.google.com/cros-engprodcomponents<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://goto.google.com/cros-engprodcomponents"><!---->https://goto.google.com/cros-engprodcomponents<!----></a><br>6. If this merge addresses a major issue in the stable channel, does it require manual verification by the test team? If so, please describe required testing.<span class="line"><!---->6.         The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/32b13d19412a9ed44d2c3892d1f75a394b84947e<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/32b13d19412a9ed44d2c3892d1f75a394b84947e"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/32b13d19412a9ed44d2c3892d1f75a394b84947e<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>32b13d19412a9ed44d2c3892d1f75a394b84947e<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/32b13d19412a9ed44d2c3892d1f75a394b84947e"><!---->32b13d19412a9ed44d2c3892d1f75a394b84947e<!----></a><br>Author: dljames <<span class="line"><!---->Author: dljames &lt;<!----></span>dljames@google.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/dljames@google.com"><!---->dljames@google.com<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Tue Mar 22 00:21:31 2022<span class="line"><!---->Date: Tue Mar 22 00:21:31 2022<!----></span><br><br>Fixes the use after free bug when creating multiple saved tab group buttons.<span class="line"><!---->Fixes the use after free bug when creating multiple saved tab group buttons.<!----></span><br><br>In short, we change OnTabGroupButtonPressed to take a const TabGroupID& so that when we use base::BindRepeating in CreateTabGroupButton the value is automagically copied in the call back. This prevents us from losing our saved tab group data and accessing garbage values.<span class="line"><!---->In short, we change OnTabGroupButtonPressed to take a const TabGroupID&amp; so that when we use base::BindRepeating in CreateTabGroupButton the value is automagically copied in the call back. This prevents us from losing our saved tab group data and accessing garbage values.<!----></span><br><br>More information for using const& can be found here: <span class="line"><!---->More information for using const&amp; can be found here: <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/HEAD/docs/callback.md#binding-const-reference-parameters<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/HEAD/docs/callback.md#binding-const-reference-parameters"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/HEAD/docs/callback.md#binding-const-reference-parameters<!----></a><br><br><br>(cherry         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

        for LitElement.

      <style>
        mr-issue-page {

        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;

          width: 100%;

          padding: 0;

          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;

        }

          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);

          min-width: 256px;

            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;

    <mr-app loginurl="https://accounts.google.com/AccountChooser?continue=https%3A%2F%2Fuc.appengine.google.com%2F_ah%2Fconflogin%3Fcontinue%3Dhttps%253A%252F%252Fbugs.chromium.org%252Fp%252Fchromium%252Fissues%252Fdetail%253Fid%253D1305706%2526q%253Dlabel%25253Aexternal_security_report%2526can%253D1%2526start%253D2800" logouturl="https://bugs.chromium.org/_ah/logout?continue=https://accounts.google.com/Logout%3Fcontinue%3Dhttps://uc.appengine.google.com/_ah/logout%253Fcontinue%253Dhttps://www.google.com/url%25253Fsa%25253DD%252526q%25253Dhttps://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail%2525253Fid%2525253D1305706%25252526q%2525253Dlabel%252525253Aexternal_security_report%25252526can%2525253D1%25252526start%2525253D2800%252526ust%25253D1703406424664731%252526usg%25253DAOvVaw3bFl3K98xTB6KJl5B1fxKm%26service%3Dah" versionbase="https://61906-5c6a57f-dot-monorail-prod.appspot.com" projectalert=""><!---->
      <style>
        
  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }
      </style>

  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;

  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically

        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>
      
      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>

        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

          UI&gt;Browser&gt;TopChrome&gt;TabStrip&gt;TabGroups
          
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        I'm not able to reproduce this bug, although I may not be interpreting <span class="line"><!---->I'm not able to reproduce this bug, although I may not be interpreting <!----></span>comment #2<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c2"><!---->comment #2<!----></a> correctly, so I'll pass along to the subsystem owner for a second opinion. <span class="line"><!----> correctly, so I'll pass along to the subsystem owner for a second opinion. <!----></span><br><br>If this is reachable, it would appear to require the user to perform a precise sequence of UI actions to trigger. Therefore, assigning Medium Severity as the highest possible applicable security severity level.<span class="line"><!---->If this is reachable, it would appear to require the user to perform a precise sequence of UI actions to trigger.         These are the steps I did to reproduce this bug:<span class="line"><!---->These are the steps I did to reproduce this bug:<!----></span><br><br>1. Enable the #tab-groups-save feature<span class="line"><!---->1. Enable the #tab-groups-save feature<!----></span><br>2. Create 2 tab groups (Does not matter how many tabs are in them)<span class="line"><!---->2. Create 2 tab groups (Does not matter how many tabs are in them)<!----></span><br>3. Save both tab groups <span class="line"><!---->3. Save both tab groups <!----></span><br>    > You should see 2 new buttons appear in the bookmarks bar with the names of the saved tab groups.<span class="line"><!---->    &gt; You should see 2 new buttons appear in the bookmarks bar with the names of the saved tab groups.<!----></span><br>4. Click on the first tab group that was saved<span class="line"><!---->4. Click on the first tab group that was saved<!----></span><br>    > Will be the leftmost tab group button if the default Left to right mode is enabled.<span class="line"><!---->    &gt; Will be the leftmost tab group button if the default Left to right mode is enabled.<!----></span><br>    > Will be the right most tab group button if Right to left mode enabled.<span class="line"><!---->    &gt; Will be the right most tab group button if Right to left mode enabled.<!----></span><br><br>Please let me know if there are any differences between these steps and the ones described above!<span class="line"><!---->Please let me know if there are any differences between these steps and the ones described above!<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">

          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1305706#c17">Comment 17<!----></a>

      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1305706#c17">Comment 17<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Wed, Mar 16, 2022, 12:22 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>

      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        we should probably go back to design and ask what we should do when there isnt any tabs in the tab group (i.e. the last tab is removed from the group, which closes the group)? there might be other issues here but we should either remove the saved tab group when there are no tabs (an invalid state for a group) or keep the last tab and just consider it a "group close" instead of removing the tab.<span class="line"><!---->we should probably go back to design and ask what we should do when there isnt any tabs in the tab group (i.e. the last tab is removed from the group, which closes the group)? there might be other issues here but we should either remove the saved tab group when there are no tabs (an invalid state for a group) or keep the last tab and just consider it a "group close" instead of removing the tab.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/f2d3c078ac66e0c535c357d8eeccc0d0fb795c4b<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/f2d3c078ac66e0c535c357d8eeccc0d0fb795c4b"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/f2d3c078ac66e0c535c357d8eeccc0d0fb795c4b<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>f2d3c078ac66e0c535c357d8eeccc0d0fb795c4b<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/f2d3c078ac66e0c535c357d8eeccc0d0fb795c4b"><!---->f2d3c078ac66e0c535c357d8eeccc0d0fb795c4b<!----></a><br>Author: dljames <<span class="line"><!---->Author: dljames &lt;<!----></span>dljames@google.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/dljames@google.com"><!---->dljames@google.com<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Fri Mar 18 17:27:41 2022<span class="line"><!---->Date: Fri Mar 18 17:27:41 2022<!----></span><br><br>Fixes the use after free bug when creating multiple saved tab group buttons.<span class="line"><!---->Fixes the use after free bug when creating multiple saved tab group buttons.<!----></span><br><br>In short, we change OnTabGroupButtonPressed to take a const TabGroupID& so that when we use base::BindRepeating in CreateTabGroupButton the value is automagically copied in the call back. This prevents us from losing our saved tab group data and accessing garbage values.<span class="line"><!---->In short, we change OnTabGroupButtonPressed to take a const TabGroupID&amp; so that when we use base::BindRepeating in CreateTabGroupButton the value is automagically copied in the call back. This prevents us from losing our saved tab group data and accessing garbage values.<!----></span><br><br>More information for using const& can be found here: <span class="line"><!---->More information for using const&amp; can be found here: <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/HEAD/docs/callback.md#binding-const-reference-parameters<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/HEAD/docs/callback.md#binding-const-reference-parameters"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/HEAD/docs/callback.md#binding-const-reference-parameters<!----></a><br><br><br>Bug: 1305706<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1305706" title="uaf in BookmarkBarView::OnTabGroupButtonPressed"><!---->Bug: 1305706<!----></a><br>Change-Id: I62a9ba403416f964dc48013ea129c44084865ded<span class="line"><!---->Change-Id: I62a9ba403416f964dc48013ea129c44084865ded<!----></span><br>Reviewed-on: <span class="line"><!---->Reviewed-on: <!----></span>https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3533522<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3533522"><!---->https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3533522<!----></a><br>Reviewed-by: Scott Violet <<span class="line"><!---->Reviewed-by: Scott Violet &lt;<!----></span>sky@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/sky@chromium.org"><!---->sky@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Commit-Queue: Darryl James <<span class="line"><!---->Commit-Queue: Darryl James &lt;<!----></span>dljames@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank"         The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/32b13d19412a9ed44d2c3892d1f75a394b84947e<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/32b13d19412a9ed44d2c3892d1f75a394b84947e"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/32b13d19412a9ed44d2c3892d1f75a394b84947e<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>32b13d19412a9ed44d2c3892d1f75a394b84947e<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/32b13d19412a9ed44d2c3892d1f75a394b84947e"><!---->32b13d19412a9ed44d2c3892d1f75a394b84947e<!----></a><br>Author: dljames <<span class="line"><!---->Author: dljames &lt;<!----></span>dljames@google.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/dljames@google.com"><!---->dljames@google.com<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Tue Mar 22 00:21:31 2022<span class="line"><!---->Date: Tue Mar 22 00:21:31 2022<!----></span><br><br>Fixes the use after free bug when creating multiple saved tab group buttons.<span class="line"><!---->Fixes the use after free bug when creating multiple saved tab group buttons.<!----></span><br><br>In short, we change OnTabGroupButtonPressed to take a const TabGroupID& so that when we use base::BindRepeating in CreateTabGroupButton the value is automagically copied in the call back. This prevents us from losing our saved tab group data and accessing garbage values.<span class="line"><!---->In short, we change OnTabGroupButtonPressed to take a const TabGroupID&amp; so that when we use base::BindRepeating in CreateTabGroupButton the value is automagically copied in the call back. This prevents us from losing our saved tab group data and accessing garbage values.<!----></span><br><br>More information for using const& can be found here: <span class="line"><!---->More information for using const&amp; can be found here: <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/HEAD/docs/callback.md#binding-const-reference-parameters<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/HEAD/docs/callback.md#binding-const-reference-parameters"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/HEAD/docs/callback.md#binding-const-reference-parameters<!----></a><br><br><br>(cherry picked from commit <span class="line"><!---->(cherry picked from commit <!----></span>f2d3c078ac66e0c535c357d8eeccc0d0fb795c4b<a class="undefined" target="_blank"         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users.            issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      <style>

              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>
          </div>

          

          <div class="edit-actions">
            <chops-button class="de-emphasized">
              Cancel
            </chops-button>
            <chops-button class="emphasized">
               issue
            </chops-button>
          </div>
        </div>

      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }

          cursor: pointer;

       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement. 
      <input id="checkbox" type="checkbox">

      <style>
        mr-issue-page {

          top: var(--monorail-header-height);

        mr-launch-overview {

            <div class="container-issue-content">
              <mr-issue-details class="main-item"><!---->
      <style>
        mr-issue-details {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background-color: var(--chops-white);
          padding-bottom: 1em;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          flex-direction: column;
          margin: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
        }
        h3 {
          margin-top: 1em;
        }
        mr-description {
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        mr-edit-issue {
          margin-top: 40px;

      </style>

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

          <chops-button>

          Note:<b>Note:</b>
          Clock icons indicate that users may not be available.
          Tooltips show the reason.

        These are the steps I did to reproduce this bug:<span class="line"><!---->These are the steps I did to reproduce this bug:<!----></span><br><br>1. Enable the #tab-groups-save feature<span class="line"><!---->1. Enable the #tab-groups-save feature<!----></span><br>2. Create 2 tab groups (Does not matter how many tabs are in them)<span class="line"><!---->2. Create 2 tab groups (Does not matter how many tabs are in them)<!----></span><br>3. Save both tab groups <span class="line"><!---->3. Save both tab groups <!----></span><br>    > You should see 2 new buttons appear in the bookmarks bar with the names of the saved tab groups.<span class="line"><!---->    &gt; You should see 2 new buttons appear in the bookmarks bar with the names of the saved tab groups.<!----></span><br>4. Click on the first tab group that was saved<span class="line"><!---->4. Click on the first tab group that was saved<!----></span><br>    > Will be the leftmost tab group button if the default Left to right mode is enabled.<span class="line"><!---->    &gt; Will be the leftmost tab group button if the default Left to right mode is enabled.<!----></span><br>    > Will be the right most tab group button if Right to left mode enabled.<span class="line"><!---->    &gt; Will be the right most tab group button if Right to left mode enabled.<!----></span><br><br>Please let me know if there are any differences between these steps and the ones described above!<span class="line"><!---->Please let me know if there are any differences between these steps and the ones described above!<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">

        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1305706#c17">Comment 17<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Wed, Mar 16, 2022, 12:22 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        </div>
        
      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1305706#c17">Comment 17<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Wed, Mar 16, 2022, 12:22 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        we should probably go back to design and ask what we should do when there isnt any tabs in the tab group (i.e. the last tab is removed from the group, which closes the group)? there might be other issues here but we should either remove the saved tab group when there are no tabs (an invalid state for a group) or keep the last tab and just consider it a "group close" instead of removing the tab.<span class="line"><!---->we should probably go back to design and ask what we should do when there isnt any tabs in the tab group (i.e. the last tab is removed from the group, which closes the group)? there might be other issues here but we should either remove the saved tab group when there are no tabs (an invalid state for a group) or keep the last tab and just consider it a "group close" instead of removing the tab.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

        The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/f2d3c078ac66e0c535c357d8eeccc0d0fb795c4b<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/f2d3c078ac66e0c535c357d8eeccc0d0fb795c4b"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/f2d3c078ac66e0c535c357d8eeccc0d0fb795c4b<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>f2d3c078ac66e0c535c357d8eeccc0d0fb795c4b<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/f2d3c078ac66e0c535c357d8eeccc0d0fb795c4b"><!---->f2d3c078ac66e0c535c357d8eeccc0d0fb795c4b<!----></a><br>Author: dljames <<span class="line"><!---->Author: dljames &lt;<!----></span>dljames@google.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/dljames@google.com"><!---->dljames@google.com<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Fri Mar 18 17:27:41 2022<span class="line"><!---->Date: Fri Mar 18 17:27:41 2022<!----></span><br><br>Fixes the use after free bug when creating multiple saved tab group buttons.<span class="line"><!---->Fixes the use after free bug when creating multiple saved tab group buttons.<!----></span><br><br>In short, we change OnTabGroupButtonPressed to take a const TabGroupID& so that when we use base::BindRepeating in CreateTabGroupButton the value is automagically copied in the call back. This prevents us from losing our saved tab group data and accessing garbage values.<span class="line"><!---->In short, we change OnTabGroupButtonPressed to take a const TabGroupID&amp; so that when we use base::BindRepeating in CreateTabGroupButton the value is automagically copied in the call back. This prevents us from losing our saved tab group data and accessing garbage values.<!----></span><br><br>More information for using const& can be found here: <span class="line"><!---->More information for using const&amp; can be found here: <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/HEAD/docs/callback.md#binding-const-reference-parameters<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/HEAD/docs/callback.md#binding-const-reference-parameters"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/HEAD/docs/callback.md#binding-const-reference-parameters<!----></a><br><br><br>Bug: I62a9ba403416f964dc48013ea129c44084865ded<span class="line"><!---->Change-Id: I62a9ba403416f964dc48013ea129c44084865ded<!----></span><br>Reviewed-on: <span class="line"><!---->Reviewed-on: <!----></span>https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3533522<a class="undefined" target="_blank" If yes, is it behind a Finch flag and are experiments active in any release channels?<!----></span><br>5. [Chrome OS only]: Was the change reviewed and approved by the Eng Prod Representative? <span class="line"><!---->5. [Chrome OS only]: Was the change reviewed and approved by the Eng Prod Representative? <!----></span>https://goto.google.com/cros-engprodcomponents<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://goto.google.com/cros-engprodcomponents"><!---->https://goto.google.com/cros-engprodcomponents<!----></a><br>6. If this merge addresses a major issue in the stable channel, does it require manual verification by the test team? If so, please describe required testing.<span class="line"><!---->6.         The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/32b13d19412a9ed44d2c3892d1f75a394b84947e<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/32b13d19412a9ed44d2c3892d1f75a394b84947e"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/32b13d19412a9ed44d2c3892d1f75a394b84947e<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>32b13d19412a9ed44d2c3892d1f75a394b84947e<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/32b13d19412a9ed44d2c3892d1f75a394b84947e"><!---->32b13d19412a9ed44d2c3892d1f75a394b84947e<!----></a><br>Author: dljames <<span class="line"><!---->Author: dljames &lt;<!----></span>dljames@google.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/dljames@google.com"><!---->dljames@google.com<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Tue Mar 22 00:21:31 2022<span class="line"><!---->Date: Tue Mar 22 00:21:31 2022<!----></span><br><br>Fixes the use after free bug when creating multiple saved tab group buttons.<span class="line"><!---->Fixes the use after free bug when creating multiple saved tab group buttons.<!----></span><br><br>In short, we change OnTabGroupButtonPressed to take a const TabGroupID& so that when we use base::BindRepeating in CreateTabGroupButton the value is automagically copied in the call back. This prevents us from losing our saved tab group data and accessing garbage values.<span class="line"><!---->In short, we change OnTabGroupButtonPressed to take a const TabGroupID&amp; so that when we use base::BindRepeating in CreateTabGroupButton the value is automagically copied in the call back. This prevents us from losing our saved tab group data and accessing garbage values.<!----></span><br><br>More information for using const& can be found here: <span class="line"><!---->More information for using const&amp; can be found here: <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/HEAD/docs/callback.md#binding-const-reference-parameters<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/HEAD/docs/callback.md#binding-const-reference-parameters"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/HEAD/docs/callback.md#binding-const-reference-parameters<!----></a><br><br><br>(cherry         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

        for LitElement.

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>

      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>

        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

            Issue 1305706: uaf in BookmarkBarView::OnTabGroupButtonPressed
          <h1>
            
            Issue 1305706: uaf in BookmarkBarView::OnTabGroupButtonPressed
          </h1>
          
            Reported by
            
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>
      wxhu...@gmail.com<a id="user-link" href="/u/1283894224" title="wxhu...@gmail.com"><!---->wxhu...@gmail.com<!----></a>
      wxhu...@gmail.com<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->wxhu...@gmail.com<!----></span>
      <div id="availability-text" class="availability-notice" title="undefined" hidden=""><!----><!----></div>
    <mr-user-link aria-label="issue reporter"></mr-user-link>
            on 
      Sat, Mar 12, 2022, 7:58 AM EST
    <chops-timestamp title="Sat, Mar 12, 2022, 7:58 AM EST"></chops-timestamp>
            
          <small class="byline">
            Reported by
            <mr-user-link aria-label="issue reporter"></mr-user-link>
            on <chops-timestamp title="Sat, Mar 12, 2022, 7:58 AM EST"></chops-timestamp>
            
          </small>
        <div class="main-text">
          <h1>
            
            Issue 1305706: uaf in BookmarkBarView::OnTabGroupButtonPressed
          </h1>

        These are the steps I did to reproduce this bug:<span class="line"><!---->These are the steps I did to reproduce this bug:<!----></span><br><br>1. Enable the #tab-groups-save feature<span class="line"><!---->1. Enable the #tab-groups-save feature<!----></span><br>2. Create 2 tab groups (Does not matter how many tabs are in them)<span class="line"><!---->2. Create 2 tab groups (Does not matter how many tabs are in them)<!----></span><br>3. Save both tab groups <span class="line"><!---->3. Save both tab groups <!----></span><br>    > You should see 2 new buttons appear in the bookmarks bar with the names of the saved tab groups.<span class="line"><!---->    &gt; You should see 2 new buttons appear in the bookmarks bar with the names of the saved tab groups.<!----></span><br>4. Click on the first tab group that was saved<span class="line"><!---->4. Click on the first tab group that was saved<!----></span><br>    > Will be the leftmost tab group button if the default Left to right mode is enabled.<span class="line"><!---->    &gt; Will be the leftmost tab group button if the default Left to right mode is enabled.<!----></span><br>    > Will be the right most tab group button if Right to left mode enabled.<span class="line"><!---->    &gt; Will be the right most tab group button if Right to left mode enabled.<!----></span><br><br>Please let me know if there are any differences between these steps and the ones described above!<span class="line"><!---->Please let me know if there are any differences between these steps and the ones described above!<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

        we should probably go back to design and ask what we should do when there isnt any tabs in the tab group (i.e. the last tab is removed from the group, which closes the group)? there might be other issues here but we should either remove the saved tab group when there are no tabs (an invalid state for a group) or keep the last tab and just consider it a "group close" instead of removing the tab.<span class="line"><!---->we should probably go back to design and ask what we should do when there isnt any tabs in the tab group (i.e. the last tab is removed from the group, which closes the group)? there might be other issues here but we should either remove the saved tab group when there are no tabs (an invalid state for a group) or keep the last tab and just consider it a "group close" instead of removing the tab.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
