        The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/f2d3c078ac66e0c535c357d8eeccc0d0fb795c4b<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/f2d3c078ac66e0c535c357d8eeccc0d0fb795c4b"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/f2d3c078ac66e0c535c357d8eeccc0d0fb795c4b<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>f2d3c078ac66e0c535c357d8eeccc0d0fb795c4b<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/f2d3c078ac66e0c535c357d8eeccc0d0fb795c4b"><!---->f2d3c078ac66e0c535c357d8eeccc0d0fb795c4b<!----></a><br>Author: dljames <<span class="line"><!---->Author: dljames &lt;<!----></span>dljames@google.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/dljames@google.com"><!---->dljames@google.com<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Fri Mar 18 17:27:41 2022<span class="line"><!---->Date: Fri Mar 18 17:27:41 2022<!----></span><br><br>Fixes the use after free bug when creating multiple saved tab group buttons.<span class="line"><!---->Fixes the use after free bug when creating multiple saved tab group buttons.<!----></span><br><br>In short, we change OnTabGroupButtonPressed to take a const TabGroupID& so that when we use base::BindRepeating in CreateTabGroupButton the value is automagically copied in the call back. This prevents us from losing our saved tab group data and accessing garbage values.<span class="line"><!---->In short, we change OnTabGroupButtonPressed to take a const TabGroupID&amp; so that when we use base::BindRepeating in CreateTabGroupButton the value is automagically copied in the call back. This prevents us from losing our saved tab group data and accessing garbage values.<!----></span><br><br>More information for using const& can be found here: <span class="line"><!---->More information for using const&amp; can be found here: <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/HEAD/docs/callback.md#binding-const-reference-parameters<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/HEAD/docs/callback.md#binding-const-reference-parameters"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/HEAD/docs/callback.md#binding-const-reference-parameters<!----></a><br><br><br>Bug: 1305706<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1305706" title="uaf in BookmarkBarView::OnTabGroupButtonPressed"><!---->Bug: 1305706<!----></a><br>Change-Id: I62a9ba403416f964dc48013ea129c44084865ded<span class="line"><!---->Change-Id: I62a9ba403416f964dc48013ea129c44084865ded<!----></span><br>Reviewed-on: <span class="line"><!---->Reviewed-on: <!----></span>https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3533522<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3533522"><!---->https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3533522<!----></a><br>Reviewed-by: Scott Violet <<span class="line"><!---->Reviewed-by: Scott Violet &lt;<!----></span>sky@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/sky@chromium.org"><!---->sky@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Commit-Queue: Darryl James <<span class="line"><!---->Commit-Queue: Darryl James &lt;<!----></span>dljames@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank"         The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/32b13d19412a9ed44d2c3892d1f75a394b84947e<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/32b13d19412a9ed44d2c3892d1f75a394b84947e"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/32b13d19412a9ed44d2c3892d1f75a394b84947e<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>32b13d19412a9ed44d2c3892d1f75a394b84947e<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/32b13d19412a9ed44d2c3892d1f75a394b84947e"><!---->32b13d19412a9ed44d2c3892d1f75a394b84947e<!----></a><br>Author: dljames <<span class="line"><!---->Author: dljames &lt;<!----></span>dljames@google.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/dljames@google.com"><!---->dljames@google.com<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Tue Mar 22 00:21:31 2022<span class="line"><!---->Date: Tue Mar 22 00:21:31 2022<!----></span><br><br>Fixes the use after free bug when creating multiple saved tab group buttons.<span class="line"><!---->Fixes the use after free bug when creating multiple saved tab group buttons.<!----></span><br><br>In short, we change OnTabGroupButtonPressed to take a const TabGroupID& so that when we use base::BindRepeating in CreateTabGroupButton the value is automagically copied in the call back. This prevents us from losing our saved tab group data and accessing garbage values.<span class="line"><!---->In short, we change OnTabGroupButtonPressed to take a const TabGroupID&amp; so that when we use base::BindRepeating in CreateTabGroupButton the value is automagically copied in the call back. This prevents us from losing our saved tab group data and accessing garbage values.<!----></span><br><br>More information for using const& can be found here: <span class="line"><!---->More information for using const&amp; can be found here: <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/HEAD/docs/callback.md#binding-const-reference-parameters<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/HEAD/docs/callback.md#binding-const-reference-parameters"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/HEAD/docs/callback.md#binding-const-reference-parameters<!----></a><br><br><br>(cherry picked from commit <span class="line"><!---->(cherry picked from commit <!----></span>f2d3c078ac66e0c535c357d8eeccc0d0fb795c4b<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/f2d3c078ac66e0c535c357d8eeccc0d0fb795c4b"><!---->f2d3c078ac66e0c535c357d8eeccc0d0fb795c4b<!----></a>)<span class="line"><!---->)<!----></span><br><br>Bug: 1305706<a         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users.         These are the steps I did to reproduce this bug:<span class="line"><!---->These are the steps I did to reproduce this bug:<!----></span><br><br>1. Enable the #tab-groups-save feature<span class="line"><!---->1. Enable the #tab-groups-save feature<!----></span><br>2. Create 2 tab groups (Does not matter how many tabs are in them)<span class="line"><!---->2. Create 2 tab groups (Does not matter how many tabs are in them)<!----></span><br>3. Save both tab groups <span class="line"><!---->3. Save both tab groups <!----></span><br>    > You should see 2 new buttons appear in the bookmarks bar with the names of the saved tab groups.<span class="line"><!---->    &gt; You should see 2 new buttons appear in the bookmarks bar with the names of the saved tab groups.<!----></span><br>4. Click on the first tab group that was saved<span class="line"><!---->4. Click on the first tab group that was saved<!----></span><br>    > Will be the leftmost tab group button if the default Left to right mode is enabled.<span class="line"><!---->    &gt; Will be the leftmost tab group button if the default Left to right mode is enabled.<!----></span><br>    > Will be the right most tab group button if Right to left mode enabled.<span class="line"><!---->    &gt; Will be the right most tab group button if Right to left mode enabled.<!----></span><br><br>Please let me know if there are any differences between these steps and the ones described above!<span class="line"><!---->Please let me know if there are any differences between these steps and the ones described above!<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1305706#c17">Comment 17<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>

        <chops-timestamp title="Wed, Mar 16, 2022, 12:22 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>

      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        we should probably go back to design and ask what we should do when there isnt any tabs in the tab group (i.e. the last tab is removed from the group, which closes the group)? there might be other issues here but we should either remove the saved tab group when there are no tabs (an invalid state for a group) or keep the last tab and just consider it a "group close" instead of removing the tab.<span class="line"><!---->we should probably go back to design and ask what we should do when there isnt any tabs in the tab group (i.e. the last tab is removed from the group, which closes the group)? there might be other issues here but we should either remove the saved tab group when there are no tabs (an invalid state for a group) or keep the last tab and just consider it a "group close" instead of removing the tab.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        </div>

        The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/f2d3c078ac66e0c535c357d8eeccc0d0fb795c4b<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/f2d3c078ac66e0c535c357d8eeccc0d0fb795c4b"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/f2d3c078ac66e0c535c357d8eeccc0d0fb795c4b<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>f2d3c078ac66e0c535c357d8eeccc0d0fb795c4b<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/f2d3c078ac66e0c535c357d8eeccc0d0fb795c4b"><!---->f2d3c078ac66e0c535c357d8eeccc0d0fb795c4b<!----></a><br>Author: dljames <<span class="line"><!---->Author: dljames &lt;<!----></span>dljames@google.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/dljames@google.com"><!---->dljames@google.com<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Fri Mar 18 17:27:41 2022<span class="line"><!---->Date: Fri Mar 18 17:27:41 2022<!----></span><br><br>Fixes the use after free bug when creating multiple saved tab group buttons.<span class="line"><!---->Fixes the use after free bug when creating multiple saved tab group buttons.<!----></span><br><br>In short, we change OnTabGroupButtonPressed to take a const TabGroupID& so that when we use base::BindRepeating in CreateTabGroupButton the value is automagically copied in the call back. This prevents us from losing our saved tab group data and accessing garbage values.<span class="line"><!---->In short, we change OnTabGroupButtonPressed to take a const TabGroupID&amp; so that when we use base::BindRepeating in CreateTabGroupButton the value is automagically copied in the call back. This prevents us from losing our saved tab group data and accessing garbage values.<!----></span><br><br>More information for using const& can be found here: <span class="line"><!---->More information for using const&amp; can be found here: <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/HEAD/docs/callback.md#binding-const-reference-parameters<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/HEAD/docs/callback.md#binding-const-reference-parameters"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/HEAD/docs/callback.md#binding-const-reference-parameters<!----></a><br><br><br>Bug: 1305706<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1305706" title="uaf in BookmarkBarView::OnTabGroupButtonPressed"><!---->Bug: 1305706<!----></a><br>Change-Id: I62a9ba403416f964dc48013ea129c44084865ded<span class="line"><!---->Change-Id: I62a9ba403416f964dc48013ea129c44084865ded<!----></span><br>Reviewed-on: <span class="line"><!---->Reviewed-on: <!----></span>https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3533522<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3533522"><!---->https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3533522<!----></a><br>Reviewed-by: Scott Violet <<span         The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/32b13d19412a9ed44d2c3892d1f75a394b84947e<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/32b13d19412a9ed44d2c3892d1f75a394b84947e"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/32b13d19412a9ed44d2c3892d1f75a394b84947e<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>32b13d19412a9ed44d2c3892d1f75a394b84947e<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/32b13d19412a9ed44d2c3892d1f75a394b84947e"><!---->32b13d19412a9ed44d2c3892d1f75a394b84947e<!----></a><br>Author: dljames <<span class="line"><!---->Author: dljames &lt;<!----></span>dljames@google.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/dljames@google.com"><!---->dljames@google.com<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Tue Mar 22 00:21:31 2022<span class="line"><!---->Date: Tue Mar 22 00:21:31 2022<!----></span><br><br>Fixes the use after free bug when creating multiple saved tab group buttons.<span class="line"><!---->Fixes the use after free bug when creating multiple saved tab group buttons.<!----></span><br><br>In short, we change OnTabGroupButtonPressed to take a const TabGroupID& so that when we use base::BindRepeating in CreateTabGroupButton the value is automagically copied in the call back. This prevents us from losing our saved tab group data and accessing garbage values.<span class="line"><!---->In short, we change OnTabGroupButtonPressed to take a const TabGroupID&amp; so that when we use base::BindRepeating in CreateTabGroupButton the value is automagically copied in the call back. This prevents us from losing our saved tab group data and accessing garbage values.<!----></span><br><br>More information for using const& can be found here: <span class="line"><!---->More information for using const&amp; can be found here: <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/HEAD/docs/callback.md#binding-const-reference-parameters<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/HEAD/docs/callback.md#binding-const-reference-parameters"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/HEAD/docs/callback.md#binding-const-reference-parameters<!----></a><br><br><br>(cherry picked from commit <span class="line"><!---->(cherry picked from commit <!----></span>f2d3c078ac66e0c535c357d8eeccc0d0fb795c4b<a class="undefined" target="_blank"         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

    <mr-issue-details class="main-item"><!---->
      <style>
        mr-issue-details {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background-color: var(--chops-white);
          padding-bottom: 1em;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          flex-direction: column;
          margin: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
        }
        h3 {
          margin-top: 1em;
        }
        mr-description {
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        mr-edit-issue {
          margin-top: 40px;
        }
      </style>
      <mr-description></mr-description>
      <mr-comment-list headinglevel="2"></mr-comment-list>
      
    <!----></mr-issue-details>
              
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      
        mr-launch-overview {
          max-width: 100%;
          display: flex;
          flex-flow: column;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          align-items: stretch;
        }
        mr-launch-overview[hidden] {
          display: none;
        }
        mr-phase {
          margin-bottom: 0.75em;
        }
      <style>
        mr-launch-overview {
          max-width: 100%;
          display: flex;
          flex-flow: column;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          align-items: stretch;
        }
        mr-launch-overview[hidden] {
          display: none;
        }
        mr-phase {
          margin-bottom: 0.75em;
        }
      </style>

        These are the steps I did to reproduce this bug:<span class="line"><!---->These are the steps I did to reproduce this bug:<!----></span><br><br>1. Enable the #tab-groups-save feature<span class="line"><!---->1. Enable the #tab-groups-save feature<!----></span><br>2. Create 2 tab groups (Does not matter how many tabs are in them)<span class="line"><!---->2. Create 2 tab groups (Does not matter how many tabs are in them)<!----></span><br>3. Save both tab groups <span class="line"><!---->3. Save both tab groups <!----></span><br>    > You should see 2 new buttons appear in the bookmarks bar with the names of the saved tab groups.<span class="line"><!---->    &gt; You should see 2 new buttons appear in the bookmarks bar with the names of the saved tab groups.<!----></span><br>4. Click on the first tab group that was saved<span class="line"><!---->4. Click on the first tab group that was saved<!----></span><br>    > Will be the leftmost tab group button if the default Left to right mode is enabled.<span class="line"><!---->    &gt; Will be the leftmost tab group button if the default Left to right mode is enabled.<!----></span><br>    > Will be the right most tab group button if Right to left mode enabled.<span class="line"><!---->    &gt; Will be the right most tab group button if Right to left mode enabled.<!----></span><br><br>Please let me know if there are any differences between these steps and the ones described above!<span class="line"><!---->Please let me know if there are any differences between these steps and the ones described above!<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>

          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1305706#c17">Comment 17<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>

        <chops-timestamp title="Wed, Mar 16, 2022, 12:22 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>

        we should probably go back to design and ask what we should do when there isnt any tabs in the tab group (i.e. the last tab is removed from the group, which closes the group)? there might be other issues here but we should either remove the saved tab group when there are no tabs (an invalid state for a group) or keep the last tab and just consider it a "group close" instead of removing the tab.<span class="line"><!---->we should probably go back to design and ask what we should do when there isnt any tabs in the tab group (i.e. the last tab is removed from the group, which closes the group)? there might be other issues here but we should either remove the saved tab group when there are no tabs (an invalid state for a group) or keep the last tab and just consider it a "group close" instead of removing the tab.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>

        The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/f2d3c078ac66e0c535c357d8eeccc0d0fb795c4b<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/f2d3c078ac66e0c535c357d8eeccc0d0fb795c4b"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/f2d3c078ac66e0c535c357d8eeccc0d0fb795c4b<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>f2d3c078ac66e0c535c357d8eeccc0d0fb795c4b<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/f2d3c078ac66e0c535c357d8eeccc0d0fb795c4b"><!---->f2d3c078ac66e0c535c357d8eeccc0d0fb795c4b<!----></a><br>Author: dljames <<span class="line"><!---->Author: dljames &lt;<!----></span>dljames@google.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/dljames@google.com"><!---->dljames@google.com<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Fri Mar 18 17:27:41 2022<span class="line"><!---->Date: Fri Mar 18 17:27:41 2022<!----></span><br><br>Fixes the use after free bug when creating multiple saved tab group buttons.<span class="line"><!---->Fixes the use after free bug when creating multiple saved tab group buttons.<!----></span><br><br>In short, we change OnTabGroupButtonPressed to take a const TabGroupID& so that when we use base::BindRepeating in CreateTabGroupButton the value is automagically copied in the call back. This prevents us from losing our saved tab group data and accessing garbage values.<span class="line"><!---->In short, we change OnTabGroupButtonPressed to take a const TabGroupID&amp; so that when we use base::BindRepeating in CreateTabGroupButton the value is automagically copied in the call back. This prevents us from losing our saved tab group data and accessing garbage values.<!----></span><br><br>More information for using const& can be found here: <span class="line"><!---->More information for using const&amp; can be found here: <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/HEAD/docs/callback.md#binding-const-reference-parameters<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/HEAD/docs/callback.md#binding-const-reference-parameters"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/HEAD/docs/callback.md#binding-const-reference-parameters<!----></a><br><br><br>Bug: 1305706<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1305706" title="uaf in BookmarkBarView::OnTabGroupButtonPressed"><!---->Bug: 1305706<!----></a><br>Change-Id: I62a9ba403416f964dc48013ea129c44084865ded<span class="line"><!---->Change-Id: I62a9ba403416f964dc48013ea129c44084865ded<!----></span><br>Reviewed-on: <span class="line"><!---->Reviewed-on: <!----></span>https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3533522<a class="undefined" target="_blank"         The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/32b13d19412a9ed44d2c3892d1f75a394b84947e<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/32b13d19412a9ed44d2c3892d1f75a394b84947e"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/32b13d19412a9ed44d2c3892d1f75a394b84947e<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>32b13d19412a9ed44d2c3892d1f75a394b84947e<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/32b13d19412a9ed44d2c3892d1f75a394b84947e"><!---->32b13d19412a9ed44d2c3892d1f75a394b84947e<!----></a><br>Author: dljames <<span class="line"><!---->Author: dljames &lt;<!----></span>dljames@google.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/dljames@google.com"><!---->dljames@google.com<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Tue Mar 22 00:21:31 2022<span class="line"><!---->Date: Tue Mar 22 00:21:31 2022<!----></span><br><br>Fixes the use after free bug when creating multiple saved tab group buttons.<span class="line"><!---->Fixes the use after free bug when creating multiple saved tab group buttons.<!----></span><br><br>In short, we change OnTabGroupButtonPressed to take a const TabGroupID& so that when we use base::BindRepeating in CreateTabGroupButton the value is automagically copied in the call back. This prevents us from losing our saved tab group data and accessing garbage values.<span class="line"><!---->In short, we change OnTabGroupButtonPressed to take a const TabGroupID&amp; so that when we use base::BindRepeating in CreateTabGroupButton the value is automagically copied in the call back. This prevents us from losing our saved tab group data and accessing garbage values.<!----></span><br><br>More information for using const& can be found here: <span class="line"><!---->More information for using const&amp; can be found here: <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/HEAD/docs/callback.md#binding-const-reference-parameters<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/HEAD/docs/callback.md#binding-const-reference-parameters"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/HEAD/docs/callback.md#binding-const-reference-parameters<!----></a><br><br><br>(cherry         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users.         1. open one tab and save as a tab group<span class="line"><!---->1. open one tab and save as a tab group<!----></span><br>2. open anathor tab and save as anathor tab group<span class="line"><!---->2. open anathor tab and save as anathor tab group<!----></span><br>3. you can see two tab group button in your bookmark view bar<span class="line"><!---->3. you can see two tab group button in your bookmark view bar<!----></span><br>4.move one of group to anathor tab group, (just let your chrome has one tab group)<span class="line"><!---->4.move one of group to anathor tab group, (just let your chrome has one tab group)<!----></span><br>5.click the old one tab group button of bookview bar.<span class="line"><!---->5.click the old one tab group button of bookview bar.<!----></span><br>6. uaf occur.<span class="line"><!---->6. uaf occur.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

        These are the steps I did to reproduce this bug:<span class="line"><!---->These are the steps I did to reproduce this bug:<!----></span><br><br>1. Enable the #tab-groups-save feature<span class="line"><!---->1. Enable the #tab-groups-save feature<!----></span><br>2. Create 2 tab groups (Does not matter how many tabs are in them)<span class="line"><!---->2. Create 2 tab groups (Does not matter how many tabs are in them)<!----></span><br>3. Save both tab groups <span class="line"><!---->3. Save both tab groups <!----></span><br>    > You should see 2 new buttons appear in the bookmarks bar with the names of the saved tab groups.<span class="line"><!---->    &gt; You should see 2 new buttons appear in the bookmarks bar with the names of the saved tab groups.<!----></span><br>4. Click on the first tab group that was saved<span class="line"><!---->4. Click on the first tab group that was saved<!----></span><br>    > Will be the leftmost tab group button if the default Left to right mode is enabled.<span class="line"><!---->    &gt; Will be the leftmost tab group button if the default Left to right mode is enabled.<!----></span><br>    > Will be the right most tab group button if Right to left mode enabled.<span class="line"><!---->    &gt; Will be the right most tab group button if Right to left mode enabled.<!----></span><br><br>Please let me know if there are any differences between these steps and the ones described above!<span class="line"><!---->Please let me know if there are any differences between these steps and the ones described above!<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

        we should probably go back to design and ask what we should do when there isnt any tabs in the tab group (i.e. the last tab is removed from the group, which closes the group)? there might be other issues here but we should either remove the saved tab group when there are no tabs (an invalid state for a group) or keep the last tab and just consider it a "group close" instead of removing the tab.<span class="line"><!---->we should probably go back to design and ask what we should do when there isnt any tabs in the tab group (i.e. the last tab is removed from the group, which closes the group)? there might be other issues here but we should either remove the saved tab group when there are no tabs (an invalid state for a group) or keep the last tab and just consider it a "group close" instead of removing the tab.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/f2d3c078ac66e0c535c357d8eeccc0d0fb795c4b<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/f2d3c078ac66e0c535c357d8eeccc0d0fb795c4b"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/f2d3c078ac66e0c535c357d8eeccc0d0fb795c4b<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>f2d3c078ac66e0c535c357d8eeccc0d0fb795c4b<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/f2d3c078ac66e0c535c357d8eeccc0d0fb795c4b"><!---->f2d3c078ac66e0c535c357d8eeccc0d0fb795c4b<!----></a><br>Author: dljames <<span class="line"><!---->Author: dljames &lt;<!----></span>dljames@google.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/dljames@google.com"><!---->dljames@google.com<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Fri Mar 18 17:27:41 2022<span class="line"><!---->Date: Fri Mar 18 17:27:41 2022<!----></span><br><br>Fixes the use after free bug when creating multiple saved tab group buttons.<span class="line"><!---->Fixes the use after free bug when creating multiple saved tab group buttons.<!----></span><br><br>In short, we change OnTabGroupButtonPressed to take a const TabGroupID& so that when we use base::BindRepeating in CreateTabGroupButton the value is automagically copied in the call back. This prevents us from losing our saved tab group data and accessing garbage values.<span class="line"><!---->In short, we change OnTabGroupButtonPressed to take a const TabGroupID&amp; so that when we use base::BindRepeating in CreateTabGroupButton the value is automagically copied in the call back. This prevents us from losing our saved tab group data and accessing garbage values.<!----></span><br><br>More information for using const& can be found here: <span class="line"><!---->More information for using const&amp; can be found here: <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/HEAD/docs/callback.md#binding-const-reference-parameters<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/HEAD/docs/callback.md#binding-const-reference-parameters"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/HEAD/docs/callback.md#binding-const-reference-parameters<!----></a><br><br><br>Bug: 1305706<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1305706" title="uaf in BookmarkBarView::OnTabGroupButtonPressed"><!---->Bug: 1305706<!----></a><br>Change-Id: I62a9ba403416f964dc48013ea129c44084865ded<span class="line"><!---->Change-Id: I62a9ba403416f964dc48013ea129c44084865ded<!----></span><br>Reviewed-on: <span class="line"><!---->Reviewed-on: <!----></span>https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3533522<a class="undefined" target="_blank"         The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/32b13d19412a9ed44d2c3892d1f75a394b84947e<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/32b13d19412a9ed44d2c3892d1f75a394b84947e"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/32b13d19412a9ed44d2c3892d1f75a394b84947e<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>32b13d19412a9ed44d2c3892d1f75a394b84947e<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/32b13d19412a9ed44d2c3892d1f75a394b84947e"><!---->32b13d19412a9ed44d2c3892d1f75a394b84947e<!----></a><br>Author: dljames <<span class="line"><!---->Author: dljames &lt;<!----></span>dljames@google.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/dljames@google.com"><!---->dljames@google.com<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Tue Mar 22 00:21:31 2022<span class="line"><!---->Date: Tue Mar 22 00:21:31 2022<!----></span><br><br>Fixes the use after free bug when creating multiple saved tab group buttons.<span class="line"><!---->Fixes the use after free bug when creating multiple saved tab group buttons.<!----></span><br><br>In short, we change OnTabGroupButtonPressed to take a const TabGroupID& so that when we use base::BindRepeating in CreateTabGroupButton the value is automagically copied in the call back. This prevents us from losing our saved tab group data and accessing garbage values.<span class="line"><!---->In short, we change OnTabGroupButtonPressed to take a const TabGroupID&amp; so that when we use base::BindRepeating in CreateTabGroupButton the value is automagically copied in the call back. This prevents us from losing our saved tab group data and accessing garbage values.<!----></span><br><br>More information for using const& can be found here: <span class="line"><!---->More information for using const&amp; can be found here: <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/HEAD/docs/callback.md#binding-const-reference-parameters<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/HEAD/docs/callback.md#binding-const-reference-parameters"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/HEAD/docs/callback.md#binding-const-reference-parameters<!----></a><br><br><br>(cherry         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users.         These are the steps I did to reproduce this bug:<span class="line"><!---->These are the steps I did to reproduce this bug:<!----></span><br><br>1. Enable the #tab-groups-save feature<span class="line"><!---->1. Enable the #tab-groups-save feature<!----></span><br>2. Create 2 tab groups (Does not matter how many tabs are in them)<span class="line"><!---->2. Create 2 tab groups (Does not matter how many tabs are in them)<!----></span><br>3. Save both tab groups <span class="line"><!---->3. Save both tab groups <!----></span><br>    > You should see 2 new buttons appear in the bookmarks bar with the names of the saved tab groups.<span class="line"><!---->    &gt; You should see 2 new buttons appear in the bookmarks bar with the names of the saved tab groups.<!----></span><br>4. Click on the first tab group that was saved<span class="line"><!---->4. Click on the first tab group that was saved<!----></span><br>    > Will be the leftmost tab group button if the default Left to right mode is enabled.<span class="line"><!---->    &gt; Will be the leftmost tab group button if the default Left to right mode is enabled.<!----></span><br>    > Will be the right most tab group button if Right to left mode enabled.<span class="line"><!---->    &gt; Will be the right most tab group button if Right to left mode enabled.<!----></span><br><br>Please let me know if there are any differences between these steps and the ones described above!<span class="line"><!---->Please let me know if there are any differences between these steps and the ones described above!<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        </div>

          Comment 17<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1305706#c17">Comment 17<!----></a>

          
        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>
      dpenning@chromium.org<a id="user-link" href="/u/1325879091" title="dpenning@chromium.org"><!---->dpenning@chromium.org<!----></a>
      dpenning@chromium.org<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->dpenning@chromium.org<!----></span>
      <div id="availability-text" class="availability-notice" title="undefined" hidden=""><!----><!----></div>
    <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        
      Wed, Mar 16, 2022, 12:22 PM EDT
    <chops-timestamp title="Wed, Mar 16, 2022, 12:22 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1305706#c17">Comment 17<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Wed, Mar 16, 2022, 12:22 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        </div>
        
      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1305706#c17">Comment 17<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Wed, Mar 16, 2022, 12:22 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        we should probably go back to design and ask what we should do when there isnt any tabs in the tab group (i.e. the last tab is removed from the group, which closes the group)? there might be other issues here but we should either remove the saved tab group when there are no tabs (an invalid state for a group) or keep the last tab and just consider it a "group close" instead of removing the tab.<span class="line"><!---->we should probably go back to design and ask what we should do when there isnt any tabs in the tab group (i.e. the last tab is removed from the group, which closes the group)? there might be other issues here but we should either remove the saved tab group when there are no tabs (an invalid state for a group) or keep the last tab and just consider it a "group close" instead of removing the tab.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

        The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/f2d3c078ac66e0c535c357d8eeccc0d0fb795c4b<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/f2d3c078ac66e0c535c357d8eeccc0d0fb795c4b"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/f2d3c078ac66e0c535c357d8eeccc0d0fb795c4b<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>f2d3c078ac66e0c535c357d8eeccc0d0fb795c4b<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/f2d3c078ac66e0c535c357d8eeccc0d0fb795c4b"><!---->f2d3c078ac66e0c535c357d8eeccc0d0fb795c4b<!----></a><br>Author: dljames <<span class="line"><!---->Author: dljames &lt;<!----></span>dljames@google.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/dljames@google.com"><!---->dljames@google.com<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Fri Mar 18 17:27:41 2022<span class="line"><!---->Date: Fri Mar 18 17:27:41 2022<!----></span><br><br>Fixes the use after free bug when creating multiple saved tab group buttons.<span class="line"><!---->Fixes the use after free bug when creating multiple saved tab group buttons.<!----></span><br><br>In short, we change OnTabGroupButtonPressed to take a const TabGroupID& so that when we use base::BindRepeating in CreateTabGroupButton the value is automagically copied in the call back. This prevents us from losing our saved tab group data and accessing garbage values.<span class="line"><!---->In short, we change OnTabGroupButtonPressed to take a const TabGroupID&amp; so that when we use base::BindRepeating in CreateTabGroupButton the value is automagically copied in the call back. This prevents us from losing our saved tab group data and accessing garbage values.<!----></span><br><br>More information for using const& can be found here: <span class="line"><!---->More information for using const&amp; can be found here: <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/HEAD/docs/callback.md#binding-const-reference-parameters<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/HEAD/docs/callback.md#binding-const-reference-parameters"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/HEAD/docs/callback.md#binding-const-reference-parameters<!----></a><br><br><br>Bug: 1305706<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1305706" title="uaf in BookmarkBarView::OnTabGroupButtonPressed"><!---->Bug: 1305706<!----></a><br>Change-Id: I62a9ba403416f964dc48013ea129c44084865ded<span class="line"><!---->Change-Id: I62a9ba403416f964dc48013ea129c44084865ded<!----></span><br>Reviewed-on: <span class="line"><!---->Reviewed-on: <!----></span>https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3533522<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3533522"><!---->https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3533522<!----></a><br>Reviewed-by: Scott Violet <<span class="line"><!---->Reviewed-by: Scott Violet &lt;<!----></span>sky@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/sky@chromium.org"><!---->sky@chromium.org<!----></a>><span         The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/32b13d19412a9ed44d2c3892d1f75a394b84947e<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/32b13d19412a9ed44d2c3892d1f75a394b84947e"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/32b13d19412a9ed44d2c3892d1f75a394b84947e<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>32b13d19412a9ed44d2c3892d1f75a394b84947e<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/32b13d19412a9ed44d2c3892d1f75a394b84947e"><!---->32b13d19412a9ed44d2c3892d1f75a394b84947e<!----></a><br>Author: dljames <<span class="line"><!---->Author: dljames &lt;<!----></span>dljames@google.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/dljames@google.com"><!---->dljames@google.com<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Tue Mar 22 00:21:31 2022<span class="line"><!---->Date: Tue Mar 22 00:21:31 2022<!----></span><br><br>Fixes the use after free bug when creating multiple saved tab group buttons.<span class="line"><!---->Fixes the use after free bug when creating multiple saved tab group buttons.<!----></span><br><br>In short, we change OnTabGroupButtonPressed to take a const TabGroupID& so that when we use base::BindRepeating in CreateTabGroupButton the value is automagically copied in the call back. This prevents us from losing our saved tab group data and accessing garbage values.<span class="line"><!---->In short, we change OnTabGroupButtonPressed to take a const TabGroupID&amp; so that when we use base::BindRepeating in CreateTabGroupButton the value is automagically copied in the call back. This prevents us from losing our saved tab group data and accessing garbage values.<!----></span><br><br>More information for using const& can be found here: <span class="line"><!---->More information for using const&amp; can be found here: <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/HEAD/docs/callback.md#binding-const-reference-parameters<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/HEAD/docs/callback.md#binding-const-reference-parameters"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/HEAD/docs/callback.md#binding-const-reference-parameters<!----></a><br><br><br>(cherry         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users.            issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

          <div class="input-grid">
            <label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            <div>
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>
          </div>

          

          
            
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

            <chops-button class="de-emphasized">

       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement.

 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
<script type="text/javascript" nonce="">
 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
</script>
